name: I Don't Care That You Don't Mind Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: After suffering near-fatal injuries in a car crash, lead singer Brad Roberts recuperated and wrote much of the CD's material in which town?
questions.explanation:
Argyle, Nova Scotia.

	While recovering, Brad made the acquaintance of some musically-talented lobstermen who played instruments and sang for the album. In fact, only Ellen Reid and Brad Roberts took part in the actual album.

questions.text: The Crash Test Dummies toured to promote the album. Which Dummy was missing from the tour?
questions.explanation:
Ben Darvill.

	Ben Darvill was busy at the time with his solo project, Son of Dave. He usually played a number of instruments for the band, including the harmonica.

questions.text:
Complete the lyric from "On and On": 
"But the little bird don't bother with _______
He knows that it just goes on and on and on and on."
questions.explanation:
song.

	"The little bird can sing and singThe little bird knows everythingBut the little bird don't bother with songHe knows that it just goes on and on and on and on."

questions.text: In the music video for "The Day We Never Met", what is the name of the character played by Brad Roberts?
questions.explanation:
Lorenzo Duke.

	Lorenzo Duke is a rock star who breaks his leg and spends his time alone spying on his female neighbors, similar to the movie "Rear Window". When he is found out, a woman takes his wheelchair away from him.

questions.text: Is this the correct lyric from "The Day We Never Met"?: " The lips I never kissed/Are lips I can't forget."
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	"The Day We Never Met" is one of my favorite songs on the album. The chorus is as follows: "The lips I never kissedAre lips I can't forgetThe dress you never woreOn the day we never metThe name I never whisperedAs it echoed in my mindThe man I never wasThe sweet thing that's not mine."

questions.text: Complete the lyric from "Let It Feel Like Something Else": "The ____________ are laughing, and the children want to cry."
questions.explanation:
stowaways.

	"Out here on the sea again,The waves are rolling highThe stowaways are laughing,And the children want to cry."

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "Little Secret": " If you wanna know just how I feel/Listen to the sound of my spinnin' ________."
questions.explanation:
wheels.

	"Bite my lip and make it bleedMy heart is running twice the speedIf you wanna know just how I feel,Listen to the sound of my spinnin' wheels."

questions.text: According to "Sittin' on a Tree Stump", what is calling the singer's name?
questions.explanation:
A bottle.

	"Listen to the grass that's out there blowin'.Look at that tractor just there sittin'.It's my name that the bottle's callin'.Listen to the goddamn song I'm singin'."

questions.text:
Complete the lyric from "Hangin' Tree": "And the _______ or so
That I wrote long ago
Don't sound good anymore anyway."
questions.explanation:
dozen.

	"A song is a thingThat you you write and you singWhen you're layin' and cryin' awayAnd the dozen or soThat I wrote long agoDon't sound good anymore anyway."

questions.text: According to "Shoot 'Em Up, Shoot 'Em Down", how many shots of morphine did the singer give his father?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	"I shot my daddy in the arm, with morphineHe said he never felt so good in all his goddamn lifeSo I shot him up just once more, for good measureHe never woke up, and ever since, it's been a mighty peaceful life."
